subclassFeature.name: Sangromancy Savant
entries: Beginning when you select this arcane tradition at 2nd level, all sangromancy spells are added to the wizard spell list for you. In addition, the gold and time you must spend to copy a sangromancy spell into your spellbook is halved.

subclassFeature.name: Full-Blooded
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you gain a pool of {@dice d12}s that you can expend instead of a hit die when you cast sangromancy spells. The number of dice in the pool equals 1 + your wizard level.
Your pool regains all expended dice when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Sanguine Vigor
entries: Starting at 6th level, your hit point maximum increases by 6 and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.
In addition, when you cast a sangromancy spell, you regain a number of hit points equal to the level of the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Blood for Blood
entries: At 10th level, when you deal damage to a creature with a spell you cast, you can expend and roll a hit die, or a {@dice d12} from your Full-Blooded feature, to add its result to the damage dealt to that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Red Renewal
entries: Starting at 14th level, when you finish a short rest, you can choose expended hit dice to recover. When you do, choose a number of expended hit dice equal to half your wizard level and regain them. You regain an equivalent number of dice from your Full Blooded feature. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Applied Leverage
entries: When you make a Strength ({@dice Athletics}) check to force open a door or container, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Camper
entries: When you make a Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check to construct a temporary shelter, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Charity Case
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Performance}) check to fake an illness, injury, or other condition, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Looter
entries: When you make an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) roll to find hidden valuables, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Pitiable
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check to convince an Aristocrat, Criminal, Militarist, or Clergy that you are not a threat or beneath their notice, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Solidarity
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check and you are interacting with members of your background, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Sticky Fingers
entries: When you make a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check to snatch something quickly, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Temperature Tolerance
entries: When you make a Constitution saving throw to avoid {@condition exhaustion} due to extreme temperatures, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Tree Springer
entries: When you make a Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check to ascend, descend, or travel between trees, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Vacant Expression
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check to feign ignorance and you are interacting with an Academic, Aristocrat, Clergy, or Militarist, you may add your profession die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Fey Form
entries: Your Charisma score increases by 2 and your Dexterity score increases by 1. An ability score cannot be increased beyond 16 this way. You also become a fey in addition to any other creature types you are. Spells that affect humanoids still affect you. However, you're immune to effects that only affect a creature of your new type of a specific CR.
When you gain this ability, you must also choose which Fey court fuels your transformation. Choose one of the following:

entries.name: The Summer Court
entries: The summer court embodies the bounty and warmth of the growing season. The fey of summer tend towards joviality, fickleness, and vanity. Creatures of summer often hide their cruel intentions behind beautiful facades.

entries.name: The Winter Court
entries: The winter court embodies the stillness and darkness of the coldest season. The fey of winter tend to be serious, cruel, and reflective. Creatures of winter are often terrifying to behold but very direct about their intentions.

optionalfeature.name: Twilight Step
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Your twilight step also gains an additional feature depending on which court you chose for your Fey Form ability.

entries.name: Summer
entries: Immediately after using your Twilight Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 damage).

entries.name: Winter
entries: Immediately after using your Twilight Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes cold damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 damage).
You can use the Twilight Step feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Planar Binding
entries: Your body and soul are bound to one of the faerie realms. You have disadvantage on death saving throws as the realm attempts to pull you back to it. If you would be killed, your soul is taken back to a plane of existence of the GM's choice. This plane is your new home, and you become an NPC under the GM's control.
If you are in the faerie realm responsible for your transformation, this flaw has no effect.

optionalfeature.name: Two-Faced
entries: You can choose to transform your face into a vision of enchanting loveliness or horrifying ugliness. Any nonfey creature within 30 feet of you when you transform your face must make a Wisdom saving throw or be affected for 1 minute.

entries.name: Summer
entries: Any creature that fails the saving throw becomes {@condition charmed}. This effect ends early on a creature if you or an ally deal damage to it or take other harmful actions.

entries.name: Winter
entries: Any creature that fails the saving throw becomes {@condition frightened} of you. This effect ends early if a creature affected by this ability ends its turn out of your line of sight.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sprite Servant
entries: A fey sprite binds itself to your service. The sprite is a floating ball of light, considered to be a Tiny creature which cannot be harmed or affected in any way. The sprite has the following characteristics:

items: The sprite has a fly speed of 40 feet.
The sprite cannot speak verbally, but it can telepathically communicate with you as long as it is within a mile of you. The sprite understands all languages you do.

The sprite can become invisible at will. Otherwise, it sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius. As a bonus action, you can command the sprite to shine more brightly. When following this command, the sprite can shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Tricks
entries: Your transformation grants you innate power, which manifests as the ability to cast a small number of spells. You learn one illusion or enchantment cantrip.

In addition, choose one {@filter 1st-level and one 2nd-level illusion or enchantment spell|spells|level=1,2|school=I,E}. You can cast each of these spells once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast them in this way when you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells. When you finish a long rest you can replace your 1st or 2nd level spell with a spell of the same level which must also be an enchantment or illusion spell.

optionalfeature.name: Queen's Servant
entries: The fey court lends you its power, and in exchange you must pay regular tribute to maintain your freedom. Twice a year, at the winter and summer solstice, you must deliver a treasure or other significant tribute to the winter or summer queen (whichever you pay allegiance to). If you do not provide a tribute by the appointed day, your queen pulls you immediately to her faerie realm.

Once pulled in this way, you must remain in the faerie realm for 100 years, or until you strike a bargain with the queen to let you return to the mortal plane. Your GM will tell you what constitutes an appropriate tribute to the court. Some fey queens prefer magic items while others wish for long kept secrets, the capture of fey criminals, or humanoid servants.

optionalfeature.name: Faerie Mantle
entries: You can use an action to wrap yourself in the majesty of the faerie for 1 minute. During this time, you project an aura of blinding beauty out to a distance of 30 feet. When creatures of your choice start their turn or move into this aura, they must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition blinded} in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition blinded} condition on a success. Once you use this action you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Made of Magic
entries: Your transformation into a fey has changed the fundamental nature of your body. You gain resistance to damage from spells.

In addition, when you make a saving throw against a spell you can use a reaction to gain advantage on the roll. Once you use this reaction, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Courtly Graces
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills determined by your court. If you are already proficient in one or both of these skills, then your proficiency bonus is doubled for ability checks using that skill. If you have or ever gain double your proficiency bonus in one or both of these skills, you gain an additional +2 for that skill.
Additionally, your fealty to a fey court offers you protection from certain emotions associated with the court. You gain a benefit based on your court.

entries.name: Summer
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill Performance} and {@skill Persuasion}, and you are immune to being {@condition charmed}.

entries.name: Winter
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill Deception} and {@skill Intimidation}, and you are immune to being {@condition frightened}.

optionalfeature.name: Bound by Words
entries: The fey choose their words carefully for they are bound by them, and so too are you. When you give your word to a humanoid creature (such as by making a promise or pledge, entering into a contract, or coming to a verbal agreement) the commitment becomes magically enforced. If you fail to fulfill your part of the agreement, you lose the benefit of all of your fey transformation boons until you surrender an additional tithe to the summer or winter queen, as described in your Queen's Command flaw. This tithe is in addition to those required by that flaw.

Importantly, you are bound by the letter of any agreement you make, not by the spirit. If you promise you will not lay a hand on the prince, for example, there would be no consequences if you kicked him (provided your hand didn't touch him in the process).

optionalfeature.name: Greater Magic Tricks
entries: Choose an {@filter enchantment or illusion spell of 3rd, 4th, and 5th level|spells|school=E,I|level=3,4,5}. You can cast each of these spells once without expending a spell slot and regain the ability to cast them in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells. When you finish a long rest you can replace your 3rd-, 4th-, or 5th-level spell with a spell of the same level, which must also be an enchantment or illusion spell.

optionalfeature.name: Misdirection
entries: Light and magic bend strangely around you, making you difficult to hit. All attack rolls against you have disadvantage. If you are hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of your next turn. This trait only works while you are conscious.

optionalfeature.name: Twilight Glamour
entries: As an action, you can become {@condition invisible}. Anything you are wearing or carrying on your person is {@condition invisible} as well. The invisibility ends if you choose to end it, if you attack, or if you cast a spell. Once your invisibility ends in this way, you cannot use this feature again for 1 minute. This trait only works while you are conscious.

optionalfeature.name: Seasonally Affected
entries: Your connection to the fey courts has granted you tremendous power but also an esoteric fragility: you gain a weakness towards cold damage if you are in the summer court, or fire damage if you are in the winter court.

If you were normally resistant to this damage type, it instead affects you normally. If you are normally immune to damage of that type, you are resistant instead. In addition, whenever you take damage of that type, your maximum hit points are reduced by an equal amount. When your maximum hit points are reduced by this effect, they return to normal after you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Form
entries: Your Constitution increases by 2 and your Wisdom score increases by 1. An ability score cannot be increased beyond 16 this way.
You become an Elemental in addition to any other creature types you are. Spells and abilities that affect Elementals of a specific CR do not affect you.

optionalfeature.name: Primordial Affinity
entries: While able to control all elements, your Primordial birth was sparked by one particular element: your Primordial Affinity. Your body is infused with malleable elemental energy. You must choose an element below and gain all the benefits of that element:

entries.name: Air
entries: You have resistance to lightning damage. In addition, you can channel the air currents around you to guide a ranged attack. Once on each of your turns, when you make a ranged weapon or ranged spell attack, you can make that attack with advanage. If you are in a location without an air current - such as underwater - this feature has no effect.

entries.name: Earth
entries: You have resistance to poison damage. In addition, whenever you gain temporary hit points, you gain that many plus your proficiency bonus instead.

entries.name: Fire
entries: You have resistance to fire damage. In addition, whenever you deal fire damage, you can add your Constitution modifier to the damage dealt.

entries.name: Water
entries: You have resistance to cold damage. In addition, whenever a creature regains hit points due to a spell or feature you control, you can imbue them with healing elemental energy. The creature regains additional hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Constitution modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Planar Binding
entries: Your body and soul are bound to a primordial plane of existence. You have disadvantage on death saving throws as the plane attempts to pull you back to it. If you would be killed, your soul is taken back to a plane of existence of the GM's choice. This plane is your new home, and you become an NPC under the GM's control.
If you are on the primordial plane responsible for your transformation, this flaw has no effect.

optionalfeature.name: Dual Nature
entries: You can choose to add a second elemental source from the Primordial Affinity Boon to add to your form. When you do so, you gain the associated benefits of your new element.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Surge
entries: You can channel pure elemental energy into a concentrated bolt of an element of your choice. On your turn, as an action you can choose one of the below choices:

entries.name: Lightning Strike
entries: You can make a special ranged attack targeting a creature within 60 feet. You are proficient with this attack, which uses your Constitution modifier. On a hit, this attack deals {@dice 3d8} + your Constitution modifier lightning damage. You can then use a bonus action to target another creature with 30 feet of the first target with the same attack. Increase the damage by {@dice 1d8} for each transformation level about 2.

entries.name: Earth Shard
entries: You can force a creature within 30 feet to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 3d6} + your Constitution modifier, or half as much on a successful save. Increase the damage by {@dice 1d6} for each transformation level about 2.
You also gain temporary hit points equal to half this amount.

entries.name: Flame Wave
entries: Each creature in a 15-foot cone originating in your square must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, creatures in the area take fire damage equal to {@dice 2d8} + your Constitution modifier. Increase the damage by {@dice 1d8} for each transformation level about 2.

entries.name: Aquatic Rejuvenation
entries: Choose a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The creature regains a number of hit points equal to {@dice 2d8} + your Constitution modifier. Increase the amount of hit points regained by {@dice 1d8} for each transformation level about 2.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier, regaining all expended uses upon completing a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Call the Four
entries: You can use your action to summon or repel elemental forces around you, causing one of the following effects of your choice:

You create a 15-foot radius globe of breathable air around you. Creatures can pass freely in or out of the globe, but other elemental forces like water or fire cannot. Alternatively, you can choose to banish all air from inside the globe. This globe lasts for 10 minutes, and you must concentrate on it (as per concentrating to maintain a spell).

You can conjure up to 50 pounds of loose earth at a point within 30 feet of you. Alternatively, you can shape the earth and stone within 15 feet of you. If affecting dirt or stone on the ground, you can cause it to become difficult terrain.
All flammable objects not worn or wielded within 30 feet of you to burst into flame. Alternatively, all nonmagical flames within 30 feet of you are immediately extinguished.

You can conjure up to 10 gallons of water at a point within 30 feet of you or cause the water to fall like rain in a 30-foot area. Alternatively, you can choose to repel water within 15 feet of you. This ability has no effect on living creatures but repels mist, rain and creates pockets of air if submerged in water.

optionalfeature.name: Primordial: Hideous Appearance
entries: Your appearance has grotesquely transformed. Your eyes might be smoldering embers, water could continuously pour from your mouth or nose, your extremities may crumble like sand, or patches of your skin might fade to transparency. Regardless of your true form, you are horrific to behold. You can suspend this form and manifest the appearance of the humanoid you once were, but this is taxing and requires concentration.
This form is not permanent, and moments of stress are likely to reveal your true nature. Your true form is revealed in the following situations:

items: Concentrating on a spell.
Gaining the {@condition unconscious} condition.
Choosing to reveal yourself.
In events of extreme emotional or physical stress, a GM may call for a Constitution saving throw with a DC of their choosing to see if you maintain your humanoid form.

entries: Non-chaotic creatures that witness your true form become hostile to you, unless the GM decides otherwise.

optionalfeature.name: Primeval Body
entries: Your transformation to an elemental form has changed your body entirely. You no longer need to sleep, breathe, or eat. You also gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Awakening
entries: You emit an aura of power that awakens the elemental forces in your companions. When you first gain this feature, choose one of the options below. You may change the aura you emit upon completing a long rest.

entries.name: Light as Air
entries: Whenever you or a friendly creature within 10 feet of you makes a Dexterity saving throw, the creature gains a bonus equal to your Constitution modifier. You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

entries.name: Forged in Fire
entries: While you are conscious, whenever you or a friendly creature within 10 feet of you deals damage with a melee weapon attack, they deal additional fire damage equal to your Constitution modifier. You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

entries.name: Heart of Stone
entries: At the beginning of your turn, you and each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier. While a creature has temporary hit points gained in this manner and are not incapacitated, they cannot be moved or knocked {@condition prone}, unless they choose to be. You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

entries.name: Spring of Life
entries: Each unconscious creature of your choice within 10 feet of you regains 1 hit point at the beginning of their turn. You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Master of Many
entries: You can choose to add a third elemental source to your form. When you do so, you gain the associated benefits of your new element from Primordial Affinity in addition to your current source benefits.

optionalfeature.name: Force of Nature
entries: You are losing your connection to societal norms. The needs of civilization, community, and morals pale in comparison to the elemental chaos roiling within you. Whenever you complete a long rest, if you are within civilization, you do not regain any hit dice or lose any levels of exhaustion. In these circumstances, the GM decides if a location is considered civilized or not. Alternatively, the GM can decide that a park or grove within a city is sufficient.

optionalfeature.name: Potent Aura
entries: Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you gain resistance to lightning, fire, poison, and cold damage.

optionalfeature.name: Energy Flow
entries: As a bonus action, you can burst into a shower of elemental material then materialize somewhere else. You magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see, along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying. Moving in this way does not provoke opportunity attacks. After teleporting, you can choose one of the following:

entries.name: Swift Assault
entries: You can immediately make a weapon attack. If you make a ranged attack, you do not have disadvantage if a hostile creature is within 5 feet.

entries.name: Spark Storm
entries: Each creature within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save creatures take {@dice 2d6} fire damage.

entries.name: Boulderous Hide
entries: Choose a damage type. Until the start of your next turn, you have resistance to that damage type.

entries.name: Sea Mother's Tether
entries: A thin tether of water links you to a creature within 30 feet. While tethered, if the creature would take damage, you can choose to take that damage instead. Additionally, if you would be damaged, the tethered creature can choose to take that damage instead. This damage cannot be reduced or prevented in any way.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier. You regain all expended uses at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Mastery
entries: You gain the fourth elemental source to your form. When you do so, you gain the associated benefits of your new element from Primordial Affinity.

Additionally, you can summon the four elements to wreath you in power. Whenever a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to force it to make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 8d6} damage of a type of your choice from cold, fire, lightning or bludgeoning, or half as much on a successful save. Until the end of your following turn, your Primal Affinity feature has the following additions:

entries.name: Air
entries: You have advantage on all ranged weapon and ranged spell attacks instead of only one.

entries.name: Earth
entries: At the beginning of your turn you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your character level.

entries.name: Fire
entries: At the beginning of your turn, each creature of your choice within 5 feet of you takes {@dice 2d6} fire damage.

entries.name: Water
entries: Whenever a creature regains hit points due to a spell or feature you control that creature regains an additional number of hit points equal to your character level.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier, regaining all uses upon completing a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Pull of Chaos
entries: Your new native plane attempts to pull you to it, laying claim to your form. Whenever you roll a natural 1 on a saving throw against a magical spell or ability, you take {@dice 1d6} force damage per two character levels in addition to any other damage or effects you would suffer, as your native plane attempts to unbind you from the Material Plane. For example, a 6th-level character would take {@dice 3d6} force damage. This damage ignores resistances and immunities.

optionalfeature.name: Spectral Presence
entries: Your Dexterity increases by 2 and your Charisma increases by 1. No ability score can increase above 16 in this way. If your transformation is due to contact with the afterlife, you become Undead in addition to any other creature types you are. If your transformation is due to an abnormality with reality, you become an Aberration in addition to any other creature types you are. Spells that affect humanoids still affect you. However, you're immune to effects that only affect a creature of your new type of a specific CR.
Also, you cease aging and cannot be aged magically.

optionalfeature.name: Spectral Movement
entries: Your walking speed increases by 10 feet. In addition, you can move through other creatures and solid objects as if they were difficult terrain and you can move through difficult terrain as if it were normal. If you end your turn inside a creature or object, you're shunted back to where you entered and take 1d6 force damage per 10 feet (rounded up) you travel in this way. Objects that have been in your possession less than 1 minute cannot move through creatures and objects with you.
As a final benefit of this boon, due to your incorporeal nature, during your turn you have resistance to all nonmagical bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing damage from sources you can see.

optionalfeature.name: Close to Death
entries: Your body and soul have a tenuous grasp on existence. You have disadvantage on death saving throws as the pull of a peaceful death calls out to you. If you would be killed, the GM chooses whether you die permanently (unable to be restored by magic) or you transform into an incorporeal undead or aberration under the GM's control. If you are on the Ethereal Plane, this flaw has no effect.

optionalfeature.name: Ethereal Phasing
entries: You can cast the {@spell blink} spell without expending a spell slot. Once you cast the spell using this boon a number of times equal to your Transformation level, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Spectral Flight
entries: You gain a fly speed equal to your walking speed.

optionalfeature.name: Horrifying Visage
entries: As an action, you can force each creature of your choice within 30 feet of and able to see you to make a Wisdom saving throw. Targets that fail the saving throw are frightened for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if you are within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. You can use this boon a number of times equal to your transformation level. You regain all uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Specter: Hideous Appearance
entries: Your true form is ghostly and haunting, whether due to your connection to death or your tenuous ties to material reality. Although your appearance isn't necessarily scary, your spectral form seems unnatural to normal creatures who might believe you to be a ghost or other sort of spirit. You can manifest as the humanoid you once were, but doing so requires concentration on your part. Moments of stress, such as the following, reveal your hideous appearance.

items: Using concentration, as if on or on a spell
Becoming {@condition unconscious}
Entering hallowed ground
Choosing to reveal your hideous appearance
In events of extreme emotional or physical stress, the GM can call for a Constitution saving throw with a DC of their choosing to see if you reveal your hideous appearance.

entries: When you reveal your hideous appearance, how viewers react is up to the GM. They might treat you as a ghost or another monster in disguise. Hostility and fear are likely reactions in these cases.

optionalfeature.name: Spectral Body
entries: Your body fades further into the immaterial, giving you certain benefits and abilities:

items: You are immune to disease, {@condition exhaustion}, and poison.
When you take damage other than force, you can use a reaction to gain resistance to the triggering damage and reveal your Hideous Appearance.
You no longer require air, food, water, or sleep.

optionalfeature.name: Life Drain
entries: Your touch disrupts the life force of other beings. As an action, you can choose a creature within 5 feet to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes {@dice 8d8} necrotic damage, and you gain half as many temporary hit points. If this damage causes the creature to drop to 0 hit points, the creature automatically dies and you regain an expended use of this boon.
You can use this boon a number of times equal to your Transformation level. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Haunting Jaunt
entries: You can use a bonus action to choose an unoccupied space within 120 feet then you fly in a direct line from your current space to that chosen space. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks. Each creature you pass through as part of this movement must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 3d6 + your Dexterity modifier psychic damage and be frightened of you until the end of your next turn.
Once you use this boon, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Untethered Mind
entries: Your mind starts to follow your body in its dissolution. Less significant memories of your existence before your specter transformation start to fade like they're dreams you've awakened from. The GM can claim you can't recall something from your living past when it's dramatic or might disadvantage you. Also, you have disadvantage whenever you attempt an Intelligence check to recall information.

This lack of connection to your previous self can cause personality changes. You might forget old grudges or traumas, which can change your personality traits or alignment for the better. It's more likely that you cling to any vestige of your old self, amplifying their importance, nursing resentments and gloomy thoughts. You might come to hate those who have a normal existence, taking a turn toward evil.

optionalfeature.name: Call of Unmaking
entries: As a bonus action, you reveal your Hideous Appearance and give a mournful wail or otherwise set up a wracking vibration. This sound has no effect on constructs and undead.

All other creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. Creatures that can't hear you have advantage on the saving throw. On a failed save, the creature bears the mark of unmaking for the next minute. While bearing this mark, a creature takes an additional {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage each time it takes damage. Once you use this boon, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Possession
entries: As an action, you reveal your Hideous Appearance and enter the space of a humanoid or beast and force that creature to make a Charisma saving throw. If the target fails, you disappear, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and loses control of its body. You control the body without depriving the target of awareness.

While possessing a target, you can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect. You retain your alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and any immunity to being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}. Otherwise, you use the possessed target's statistics but don't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, and proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the possessed target drops to 0 hit points, you end it as a bonus action, or until you are forced out by an effect that ends possession. When the possession ends, you reappear in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. You can use this boon again only after you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Ethereal Denizen
entries: You can sense invisible creatures and objects, and those in the nearby Ethereal Plane, as if you are always under the effect of the {@spell see invisibility} spell.

Additionally, you can use an action to cast the {@spell etherealness} spell without expending a spell slot. Once you cast the spell using this boon, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Pull of Oblivion
entries: Dissolution pulls on your body and soul. Whenever you roll a natural 1 on a saving throw against an effect that deals you damage, you lose {@dice 1d6} hit points per two levels you have as the afterlife or your lack of reality pulls you toward nothingness. If you die, your body disappears, and you can be raised from the dead only with a wish spell or true resurrection spell. If you and the GM agree, you might instead become an NPC monster under the GM's control, such as a {@creature wraith} or a bizarre space-time aberration.

optionalfeature.name: Unearthly Senses
entries: Начиная со 2-го уровня, вы можете использовать бонусное действие, чтобы улучшить органы чувств своего тела или вырастить совершенно новые. Пока этот эффект активен, вы можете выбрать одну из следующих адаптаций:

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: Ваши глаза выпучиваются, кожу покалывает, а ноздри раздуваются. Вы получаете преимущество при проверках мудрости ({@skill Perception}), которые зависят от зрения, слуха или обоняния.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Ваши глаза приобретают вид кошачьих, увеличиваясь и заполняя верхнюю половину лица. Вы можете видеть при тусклом свете в радиусе 60 футов от вас, как при ярком свете, а в темноте - как при тусклом свете. В темноте вы не можете различать цвета, только оттенки серого. Если вы уже обладаете темным зрением из другого источника, расстояние увеличивается до 120 футов.

entries.name: Third Eye
entries: Из вашего лба появляется еще один глаз, дающий вам способность видеть невидимых существ и предметы так, как если бы они были видимыми.

Эти Адаптации действуют до тех пор, пока вы не станете {@condition unconscious}, не используете другую Адаптацию или не используете бонусное действие в свой ход, чтобы завершить Адаптацию. Когда вы достигнете 4-го уровня трансформации, вы можете выбрать две из перечисленных адаптаций вместо одной.

optionalfeature.name: Shifting Form
entries: Ваше тело начало терять свою связность, размягчаясь и смещаясь, как густое желе. Вы не получаете дополнительного урона от критических ударов из-за смещения внутренних органов. Каждый раз, когда вы атакуете в ближнем или дальнем бою, используя свои Элдрические конечности, вы наносите дополнительный {@dice 1d6} урон кислотой. Вы получаете сопротивление к кислотному урону.

optionalfeature.name: Amorphous Flesh
entries: Ваше тело продолжает растворяться в едкой жиже из плоти и костей, похожей на тину. Вы способны перемещаться сквозь щели шириной до 1 дюйма, и у вас есть иммунитет к состояниям "захват", "лежачий" и "сдерживание".

Кроме того, всякий раз, когда вы получаете 10 или более очков колющего, пронзающего или режущего урона, вы можете выбрать продолжение разделения вдоль раны, разделяясь на две отдельные части, которые превращаются в версии себя, которые на один размер меньше оригинала, каждая с половиной ваших текущих хит-пойнтов. Если у вас нечетное количество хит-поинтов, вы сами выбираете, какой сегмент получит дополнительный 1 хп. При разделении вы можете выбрать, как ваша броня и другое снаряжение будут разделены между двумя частями.

В свой ход вы можете перемещаться с помощью каждой формы, а также совершать одно действие с помощью каждой формы. За ход вы можете совершить только одно бонусное действие и одну реакцию, хотя вы можете выбрать, в каком сегменте вы хотите действовать.

Вы можете превратиться в одно тело в качестве действия, которое может быть выполнено любым из сегментов, когда они оба находятся в пределах 5 футов друг от друга. Если вы это сделаете, то получите хит-пойнты, равные количеству хит-пойнтов, имеющихся у вашей второй формы, и станете нормального размера. Ваше второе тело существует в течение часа, после чего растворяется в небытии.

optionalfeature.name: Brand of the Slaver's Flesh
entries: В качестве действия в вашей руке появляется огненный хлыст и бросается на существо, которое вы видите в радиусе 10 футов от вас. Это существо должно сделать бросок на ловкость против вашего DC броска на трансформацию. Если бросок провален, существо получает 2d4 урона огнем и поражается обжигающим клеймом.

Пока существо заклеймено таким образом, оно привязано к вам поводком пламени и не может использовать свое движение, чтобы отойти от вас более чем на 10 футов. В свой ход вы можете использовать бонусное действие, чтобы протащить существо на расстояние до 10 футов в любом направлении. Вы также можете использовать свою реакцию, чтобы предотвратить любое событие, которое выведет существо из зоны действия. Например, если заклейменное существо использует заклинание {@spell misty step}, чтобы выйти из радиуса 10 футов, или союзник цели попытается физически вытащить своего союзника из зоны действия поводка, попытка провалится.
Заклинания, способные телепортировать несколько человек, например {@spell dimension door}, действуют по назначению для всех участников, кроме заклейменного существа.

Существо остается заклейменным таким образом в течение 1 минуты. Клеймо исчезает, если существо сбито с ног {@condition unconscious}, попадает на освященную землю, становится целью заклинания {@spell remove curse} или если существо находится на расстоянии более 10 футов от вас в конце любого хода.

optionalfeature.name: Infernal Sub-Contractor
entries: Ваше владение инфернальными законами позволяет вам использовать преимущества двух Даров Проклятия одновременно. Кроме того, вы можете менять дары во время короткого отдыха вместо длительного.

optionalfeature.name: Loophole
entries: Будучи экспертом в магии связывания и составления магических контрактов, вы получаете представление о работе заклинаний вызова и о том, как им помешать. Всякий раз, когда вы встречаете вызванное существо, вы сразу же понимаете, что оно было вызвано. В качестве действия вы можете перехватить контроль над заклинанием вызова у его создателя. Заклинатель должен сделать бросок на спасбросок мудрости против вашего DC спасброска трансформации. В случае неудачи вы получаете контроль над заклинанием и всеми оставшимися существами, как если бы вы произнесли заклинание, включая концентрацию на весь оставшийся срок. Вы можете использовать эту способность несколько раз, равное вашему модификатору Харизмы (минимум 1), и вы восстанавливаете все использования этой способности, когда завершаете длительный отдых.

optionalfeature.name: Phylactery Bond
entries: Вы разделяете особенно сильную связь со своим филактерием и получаете преимущества от его ношения на себе. Вы можете сделать из своего филактерия амулет, кольцо, брошь или другое украшение. Когда вы завершаете короткий или долгий отдых и носите филактерий, вы можете выбрать тип урона, отличный от лучевого. Пока вы носите филактерий, у вас есть иммунитет к этому типу урона. Кроме того, ваша филактерия более устойчива, чем обычная. AC вашего филактерия становится 20, а его хит-пойнты увеличиваются до 120.

Природа вашего филактерия скрыта от случайного наблюдения, и наблюдатель должен сделать проверку интеллекта ({@skill Arcana}) против вашего DC спасения от трансформации, чтобы определить ваш филактерий.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Phylactery
entries: Ваша связь с филактерией укрепляется, давая дополнительные преимущества:

items: Если на вас нет доспехов, ваш базовый класс брони равен 15 + ваш модификатор ловкости. AC вашей филактерии увеличивается на 2.
DC спасброска заклинаний и бонус атаки заклинаний увеличиваются на 2.
Вы и ваша филактерия имеете преимущество при бросках спасбросков против заклинаний и других магических эффектов.

optionalfeature.name: Soul Reflection
entries: Вы научились использовать свою связь с филактерией с максимальной эффективностью. Когда вы носите свою филактерию, всякий раз, когда на вас направлено заклинание, если вы являетесь единственной целью, вы можете использовать свою реакцию и потратить заряды из своей филактерии, равные уровню заклинания. Если вы это сделаете, заклинание отразится и вместо него будет нацелено на соответствующую цель по вашему выбору в радиусе действия заклинания, как если бы вы его произнесли. Для использования этой способности кантрийные заклинания считаются заклинаниями 1-го уровня.

optionalfeature.name: Heart of the Wild
entries: The spirits of nature speak to you through your bestial side, offering you guidance and knowledge. You may now cast and concentrate on spells in hybrid form. Additionally, you can speak, read, and write Sylvan, and you have advantage on Wisdom and Charisma checks to interact with fey and beasts.

optionalfeature.name: Call the Pack
entries: When you use your Hunter's Howl ability, up to three allies you designate within 60 feet of the target also gain the benefits. Your Hunter's Howl also grants those allies advantage on attack rolls against the target if another affected ally is within 5 feet of the creature and not {@condition incapacitated}.
Additionally, when a hostile creature afflicted by your Hunters, Howl dies, you regain hit points equal to twice your Strength modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: Your bite attack damage increases to {@dice 2d8}. If you hit a creature with a bite attack, you can force the creature to make a Strength saving throw against your Transformation Save DC or be {@condition grappled}. While the target is {@condition grappled} in this way, you have advantage on attack rolls against them and deal additional damage with your natural weapons equal to your Strength modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Protection
entries: When you or an allied creature you can see within 30 feet is targeted by an attack, you can use your reaction to shield them with holy light. The target gains a +4 bonus to AC against the attack. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Holy Bulwark
entries: You may use your action to steel yourself against the tactics of your most hated adversaries, gaining one of the following benefits:

entries.name: Stand Against the Infernal
entries: You gain resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Cleanse the Undead
entries: You gain resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Ignore Fey Trickery
entries: You are immune to {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions.
This effect lasts until you use this feature again.

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Celestial Resilience
entries: You emit an aura of stalwart conviction. This aura radiates up to 20 feet from you while you are conscious. When you or an ally within range of your aura fails a saving throw, they can choose to succeed it instead. Once a creature has benefited from this feature, they cannot benefit from it again until they have completed a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Night Stalker
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill Stealth}. If you already have proficiency in {@skill Stealth}, then your proficiency bonus is doubled when making {@skill Stealth} ability checks. Additionally, you can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured, including dim light.
You also gain a climb speed equal to your walking speed. You can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Shapechanger
entries: When you use your Shapechanger ability, you may also take on the form of a {@creature dire wolf}. While in dire wolf form you gain the following features:

Your movement speed changes to 50 feet. If you have sunlight hypersensitivity, it is reduced to sunlight sensitivity: while in sunlight, you have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks, but take no damage from direct contact with sunlight.

While in dire wolf form, you can't speak. Any object you are holding or armor you are wearing merges into your wolf form or immediately drops to the ground. The GM may decide if they feel the object cannot merge.
If you become {@condition unconscious} in dire wolf form, you revert back to your vampiric form.

Additionally, you gain the ability to use Fanged Bite while in animal form. The piercing damage for your Fanged Bite changes based on your form. While in bat form you deal 1 piercing damage, and while in dire wolf form you deal {@dice 2d6} piercing damage.

While in mist form you may cast the spell {@spell fog cloud} once without expending a spell slot and without using verbal, somatic, or material components. You regain the ability to cast this spell when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Innate Sangromancy
entries: You know all {@filter Sangromancy Spells|spells|school=S}. When casting a spell using Sangromancy, you may use FP instead of spending hit dice. Treat these FP as {@dice 1d12} hit dice. When you cast a spell in this way you do not generate FP from Sanguine Magic and you may choose a single effect to apply to the spell by spending additional FP:

entries.name: Beguiling Spell (2 FP)
entries: When a creature fails their saving throw against this spell, they are also {@condition charmed} by you until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Shadow Spell (2 FP)
entries: When a creature fails their saving throw against this spell, they are unable to perceive you until the end of your next turn, except by magical means.

entries.name: Withering Spell (3 FP)
entries: When you cast a spell that deals necrotic damage, it deals an additional {@dice 1d8} necrotic damage per spell level. A creature damaged by this spell cannot take reactions until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Vampiric Spell (3 FP)
entries: When you cast a spell that deals necrotic damage, you heal for up to half the amount of damage dealt.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Befuddled
entries: As an action you can spend 2 jinx points, and the creature marked by your evil eye is charmed for 10 minutes. When you do, the creature is no longer marked by your evil eye, and the charmed condition ends early if you or your allies deal damage to the creature or cause it to make a saving throw. After the 10 minutes have elapsed, the creature knows you used magic to influence its mood and disposition towards you.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Clumsy
entries: When a creature marked by your evil eye moves 5 feet or more, you can use your reaction and spend 3 jinx points to cause the creature to fall prone and have its movement speed reduced to 0 until the end of the turn. When you do, the creature is no longer marked by your evil eye.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Debilitated
entries: When a creature marked by your evil eye takes damage, you can use your reaction and spend 1 jinx point to roll {@dice 1d12}. The creature takes necrotic damage and reduces its maximum hit points equal to the result.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Doomed
entries: After you miss with a weapon attack against a creature marked by your evil eye, you can use your reaction and spend 1 jinx point to make an additional weapon attack against the creature as part of the same action.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Fearful
entries: As an action you can spend 2 jinx points, and the creature marked by your evil eye is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. When you do, the creature is no longer marked by your evil eye, and it can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending this misfortune early on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Inept
entries: After a creature marked by your evil eye makes an ability check or attack roll, but before the DM declares whether or not it is successful, you can use your reaction and spend 1 jinx point to make the creature reroll and use the lower result.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Insensate
entries: As an action you can spend 3 jinx points, and the creature marked by your evil eye is {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. When you do, the creature is no longer marked by your evil eye, and it can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending this misfortune early on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Maimed
entries: When you hit a creature marked by your evil eye with a weapon attack, and the die result was 18 or 19, you can use your reaction and spend 2 jinx points to turn the hit into a critical.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Marked
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can spend 2 jinx points to enhance the effects of your evil eye on a creature you have marked by it. When you do, the duration increases to 24 hours or until you mark a different creature with your evil eye, whichever comes first. Additionally, while the creature is marked by your evil eye, you always know the direction and distance to the creature, provided you are on the same plane.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Plagued
entries: When a creature marked by your evil eye regains hit points, you can use your reaction and spend 1 jinx point to halve the amount of hit points regained. When you do, the creature can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Ruined
entries: After a creature marked by your evil eye makes a saving throw, but before the DM declares whether or not it is successful, you can use your reaction and spend 2 jinx points to make the creature reroll and use the lower result.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Somnolent
entries: As an action, you can spend 3 jinx points, and the creature marked by your evil eye becomes drowsy. Roll a number of d10 equal to your level in this class and add 15 to their total. If the creature's current hit points are equal to or less than the total, it goes unconscious. The target regains consciousness after 10 minutes, or when it takes damage or another creature uses its action to rouse it.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Unlucky
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can spend 2 jinx points to put a pox on a creature marked by your evil eye. Whenever the creature makes an attack roll or saving throw, you roll {@dice 1d4} and subtract the result from their total. This pox ends when the creature is no longer marked by your evil eye.

optionalfeature.name: Adrenal Injection
entries: For the next minute, your movement speed is increased by 10 feet and your jumping distances are tripled.

optionalfeature.name: Allsense Injection
entries: For the next minute, you have {@sense blindsight} out to a distance of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Eye Oil
entries: For the next hour, you can sense magic as if you were under the effects of the {@spell detect magic} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Draught of Bull's Strength
entries: For the next 10 minutes, you have advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Draught of Cat's Grace
entries: For the next 10 minutes, you have advantage on Dexterity ability checks and saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Draught of Bear's Endurance
entries: For the next 10 minutes, you have advantage on Constitution ability checks and saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Draught of Fox's Cunning
entries: For the next 10 minutes, you have advantage on Intelligence ability checks and saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Draught of Owl's Wisdom
entries: For the next 10 minutes, you have advantage on Wisdom ability checks and saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Draught of Eagle's Splendor
entries: For the next 10 minutes, you have advantage on Charisma ability checks and saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Elfsight Oil
entries: For the next 8 hours, you have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 120 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Fleshknit Phosphate
entries: For the next minute, if you have at least 1 hit point, you heal a number of hit points equal to your proficiency bonus at the start of each of your turns.

optionalfeature.name: Ironmind Injection
entries: For the next hour, you have advantage on saving throws made against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

optionalfeature.name: Liquid Courage
entries: You gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution ability score plus twice your level in this class. You lose any remaining temporary hit points from this compound after 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Liquid Rage
entries: For the next minute, your weapon attacks deal an extra {@condition 1d4} damage.

optionalfeature.name: Presto Powder
entries: For the next 10 minutes, you have advantage on ability checks made to determine initiative and you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action.

optionalfeature.name: Spellshine Ointment
entries: For the next minute, you have resistance to damage from spells.

optionalfeature.name: Steelskin Ointment
entries: For the next minute, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Tenmen Tincture
entries: For the next hour, you count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity, and you ignore the heavy property of weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Advanturer's Talent: Barbarian
entries: You've learned to fight with primal ferocity. On your turn, you can enter a rampage as a bonus action. While rampaging and not wearing heavy armor, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. You can't concentrate on spells while rampaging. Your rampage lasts for 1 minute but ends early if you are knocked unconscious. Once you have rampaged, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Advanturer's Talent: Cleric
entries: You've gained the ability to channel divine energy directly from the gods, emboldening your allies and sanctifying their attacks. As a bonus action, you choose a creature within 30 feet. The chosen creature gains temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier + half your level in this class for 10 minutes. While a creature has temporary hit points granted by this spell, they can choose to lose these temporary hit points when they hit a creature with an attack, dealing additional radiant damage equal to the temporary hit points they lost. Once you use this talent, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Advanturer's Talent: Druid
entries: You can cast the {@spell polymorph} spell without expending a spell slot. If you cast the {@spell polymorph} spell with this trait, you can only transform yourself into a beast with a CR less than half your level in this class. Once you cast the spell with this trait, you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

optionalfeature.name: Advanturer's Talent: Fighter
entries: You gain proficiency with martial weapons and shields. You also choose and learn one of the {@filter Fighting Styles|optionalfeatures|feature type=FS:F} available to the Fighter class.

optionalfeature.name: Advanturer's Talent: Monk
entries: While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier. In addition, you can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes and you can roll a d6 in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strike. When you use the Attack action and only make attacks with unarmed strikes on your turn, you can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Advanturer's Talent: Paladin
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one spell slot to deal radiant damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage. The extra damage is {@dice 1d6} for a 1st-level spell slot, plus 1d6 for each spell level higher than 1st, to a maximum of {@dice 5d6}. The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} if the target is an undead or a fiend, to a maximum of {@dice 6d6}. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all uses of this feature at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Advanturer's Talent: Ranger
entries: You've learned the {@spell hunter's mark} spell, which counts as a bard spell for you but does not count against your bard spells known. You can cast this spell without expending a spell slot as if you had expended your highest spell slot. Once you cast the spell using this talent, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Advanturer's Talent: Rogue
entries: You've adopted the quick thinking of clever heroes that outsmart their foes. You can take a bonus action on each of your turns in combat to take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action.

optionalfeature.name: Advanturer's Talent: Sorcerer
entries: You have 2 sorcery points and learn one of the following Metamagic options available to the sorcerer class: {@optfeature Careful Spell}, {@optfeature Distant Spell}, {@optfeature Empowered Spell}, {@optfeature Extended Spell}, {@optfeature Quickened Spell}, or {@optfeature Subtle Spell}. In addition, you can use an action and expend a spell slot to gain sorcery points equal to the level of the spell slot expended. When you finish a long rest, you reset to 2 sorcery points. When you gain a level in this class, you can replace the Metamagic option you know and replace it with another Metamagic option from the list.

optionalfeature.name: Advanturer's Talent: Warlock
entries: You learn one {@filter eldritch invocation|optionalfeatures|feature type=EI} of your choice. If an eldritch invocation has a level requirement, you use half your level in this class to determine your eligibility. When you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the invocations you know and replace it with another invocation that you could learn at that level.

optionalfeature.name: Advanturer's Talent: Wizard
entries: You learn any two spells from the {@filter wizard spell list|spells|class=Wizard} that are of a level you can cast. These count as bard spells for you but do not count against your number of bard spells known. When you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the wizard spells you know and replace it with another spell from the wizard spell list of a level you can cast.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The swarm has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm of vermin can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a tiny beast.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) damage.

monster.name: Primal Striker of the Land
languages: understands your languages but can't speak

trait.name: Enraged Strikes
entries: While you are raging, the striker's natural weapon attacks gain a damage bonus equal to your Rage Damage.

trait.name: Primal Companion
entries: The guardian uses your proficiency bonus to the skills and saving throws. You add double your proficiency bonus to its {@skill Intimidation} checks{@homebrew *|This feature is added because of the platform's limitations.}.

action.name: Natural Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2 + PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage.

reaction.name: Harry
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the striker is attacked, the striker gives that attack roll advantage.

monster.name: Primal Striker of the Sky
languages: understands your languages but can't speak

trait.name: Enraged Strikes
entries: While you are raging, the striker's natural weapon attacks gain a damage bonus equal to your Rage Damage.

trait.name: Primal Companion
entries: The guardian uses your proficiency bonus to the skills and saving throws. You add double your proficiency bonus to its {@skill Intimidation} checks{@homebrew *|This feature is added because of the platform's limitations.}.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The striker doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Natural Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2 + PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage.

monster.name: Primal Striker of the Sea
languages: understands your languages but can't speak

trait.name: Enraged Strikes
entries: While you are raging, the striker's natural weapon attacks gain a damage bonus equal to your Rage Damage.

trait.name: Primal Companion
entries: The guardian uses your proficiency bonus to the skills and saving throws. You add double your proficiency bonus to its {@skill Intimidation} checks{@homebrew *|This feature is added because of the platform's limitations.}.

trait.name: Aquatic Assault
entries: While the striker is submerged in water it has advantage on natural weapon attacks made against other creatures without a swim speed submerged in water.

action.name: Natural Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2 + PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage.

monster.name: Primal Guardian of the Sky
languages: understands your languages but can't speak

trait.name: Protective Instinct
entries: When the guardian's hit points fall below half its maximum, it's enraged for 10 minutes, gaining temporary hit points equal to half of its maximum. While enraged, hostile creatures within 5 feet have disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than the guardian.

trait.name: Vigilant
entries: The guardian can't be surprised.

trait.name: Primal Companion
entries: The guardian uses your proficiency bonus to the skills and saving throws. You add double your proficiency bonus to its {@skill Intimidation} checks{@homebrew *|This feature is added because of the platform's limitations.}.

action.name: Natural Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2 + PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage.

reaction.name: Body Block
entries: When an ally within 5 feet of it is hit by an attack, the guardian takes the damage instead.

monster.name: Primal Guardian of the Sea
languages: understands your languages but can't speak

trait.name: Protective Instinct
entries: When the guardian's hit points fall below half its maximum, it's enraged for 10 minutes, gaining temporary hit points equal to half of its maximum. While enraged, hostile creatures within 5 feet have disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than the guardian.

trait.name: Vigilant
entries: The guardian can't be surprised.

trait.name: Primal Companion
entries: The guardian uses your proficiency bonus to the skills and saving throws. You add double your proficiency bonus to its {@skill Intimidation} checks{@homebrew *|This feature is added because of the platform's limitations.}.

reaction.name: Body Block

languages: understands your languages but can't speak

trait.name: Protective Instinct
entries: When the guardian's hit points fall below half its maximum, it's enraged for 10 minutes, gaining temporary hit points equal to half of its maximum. While enraged, hostile creatures within 5 feet have disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than the guardian.

trait.name: Vigilant
entries: The guardian can't be surprised.

trait.name: Primal Companion
entries: The guardian uses your proficiency bonus to the skills and saving throws. You add double your proficiency bonus to its {@skill Intimidation} checks{@homebrew *|This feature is added because of the platform's limitations.}.

action.name: Natural Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2 + PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage.

reaction.name: Body Block
